title: Case Management Walkthrough
description: Learn how to create, manage, and track legal cases from start to finish

steps.title: Navigate to Cases
steps.content: Click on 'Cases' in the sidebar to access the case management module. This is your central hub for managing all legal cases.

steps.title: Create New Case
steps.content: Click the '+ New Case' button to start creating a new case. This opens the case creation form with all necessary fields.

steps.title: Fill Case Details
steps.content: Complete the case information including title, client, case type, priority, and description. Required fields are marked with an asterisk.

steps.title: Assign Team Members
steps.content: Select the lead attorney and supporting team members. This determines who has access to the case and receives notifications.

steps.title: Set Important Dates
steps.content: Add key deadlines, court dates, and milestones. The system will automatically create reminders and track SLA compliance.

steps.title: Save the Case
steps.content: Click 'Save' to create the case. You'll be redirected to the case overview where you can add documents and tasks.

steps.title: Case List Overview
steps.content: View all your cases here. Use filters to find specific cases by status, client, or assigned team member. Click any case to view details.

steps.title: Case Actions
steps.content: Access quick actions like editing case details, adding documents, creating tasks, or changing case status from the action menu.

title: Document Management Tour
description: Master document upload, organization, and sharing workflows

steps.title: Access Documents
steps.content: Navigate to the Documents section to manage all your case-related files and folders.

steps.title: Folder Organization
steps.content: Documents are organized by case and folder type. You can create custom folders or use the default structure for pleadings, discovery, evidence, etc.

steps.title: Upload Documents
steps.content: Click 'Upload' to add new documents. You can drag and drop files or use the file browser to select multiple files at once.

steps.title: Document Details
steps.content: Add document descriptions, select the appropriate case and folder, and set access permissions. Use tags to make documents searchable.

steps.title: Document Preview
steps.content: Click on any document to preview it without downloading. The system supports PDF, images, and text documents for preview.

steps.title: Share Documents
steps.content: Use the share button to securely share documents with team members, clients, or external parties with appropriate access controls.

steps.title: Version Management
steps.content: When uploading a file with the same name, the system creates a new version. View version history and restore previous versions if needed.

steps.title: Search Documents
steps.content: Use the search function to find documents by name, content, tags, or metadata. Advanced filters help narrow down results.

title: Hearing Scheduling Guide
description: Learn to schedule court hearings and manage calendar integration

steps.title: Open Hearings Module
steps.content: Access the Hearings section to schedule court dates, depositions, and other case-related meetings.

steps.title: Calendar Overview
steps.content: View all scheduled hearings in calendar format. Switch between month, week, and day views to see different levels of detail.

steps.title: Schedule New Hearing
steps.content: Click 'Schedule Hearing' to create a new court appearance or meeting. This opens the hearing creation form.

steps.title: Hearing Information
steps.content: Fill in hearing details including case, type, court, judge, date, and time. Add a description and any special instructions.

steps.title: Manage Attendees
steps.content: Add attorneys, clients, witnesses, and other participants. The system will send calendar invitations to all attendees.

steps.title: Calendar Sync
steps.content: Enable calendar integration to automatically sync hearings with Google Calendar, Outlook, or other calendar systems.

steps.title: Set Reminders
steps.content: Configure automatic reminders for preparation tasks, document deadlines, and the hearing itself. Customize timing and recipients.

steps.title: Hearing Notes
steps.content: During or after the hearing, add notes, outcomes, and follow-up tasks. These become part of the case timeline.

title: Task Management System
description: Organize work with tasks, deadlines, and team collaboration

steps.title: Access Task Management
steps.content: Navigate to Tasks to view, create, and manage work items across all your cases and projects.

steps.title: Task Board View
steps.content: View tasks in different formats: list view for details, board view for workflow stages, or calendar view for deadlines.

steps.title: Create New Task
steps.content: Click 'New Task' to create work items. Tasks can be case-specific or general administrative work.

steps.title: Task Details
steps.content: Provide task description, priority level, due date, and estimated time. Link tasks to specific cases for better organization.

steps.title: Assign Tasks
steps.content: Assign tasks to team members, set dependencies, and configure approval workflows. Assigned users receive notifications.

steps.title: Track Progress
steps.content: Monitor task completion, time spent, and progress updates. Use status updates to keep stakeholders informed.

steps.title: Task Templates
steps.content: Use pre-defined task templates for common workflows like case intake, discovery, or trial preparation to ensure consistency.

steps.title: SLA Monitoring
steps.content: Track service level agreements and deadline compliance. The system alerts you when tasks approach their deadlines.

title: Client Portal Overview
description: Understanding the client-facing portal features and capabilities

steps.title: Client Portal Access
steps.content: The Client Portal provides secure access for clients to view their case information, documents, and communicate with the legal team.

steps.title: Client Dashboard
steps.content: Clients see a personalized dashboard with their active cases, recent updates, upcoming hearings, and important notifications.

steps.title: Document Sharing
steps.content: Control which documents clients can access. Set permissions for viewing, downloading, or uploading documents.

steps.title: Secure Messaging
steps.content: Clients can send secure messages to their legal team and receive important updates through the portal messaging system.

steps.title: Client Configuration
steps.content: Configure client access levels, notification preferences, and portal features available to different types of clients.

title: Reports and Analytics
description: Generate insights with comprehensive reporting tools

steps.title: Access Reporting
steps.content: Navigate to Reports to access comprehensive analytics and generate custom reports for cases, performance, and billing.

steps.title: Report Categories
steps.content: Choose from predefined report categories: Case Reports, Time & Billing, Performance Analytics, or create custom reports.

steps.title: Apply Filters
steps.content: Use date ranges, case types, team members, and other filters to focus your reports on specific data sets.

steps.title: Generate Reports
steps.content: Click 'Generate Report' to create your custom report. Reports can be viewed online, exported to PDF, or downloaded as Excel files.

steps.title: Schedule Reports
steps.content: Set up automatic report generation and delivery. Schedule weekly, monthly, or quarterly reports to be emailed to stakeholders.

steps.title: Dashboard Widgets
steps.content: Add key metrics to your dashboard for quick access to important statistics and performance indicators.

title: Task Automation Setup
description: Learn to create automation rules and templates for efficient task management

steps.title: Task Automation Overview
steps.content: Welcome to Task Automation! This powerful feature helps you automate repetitive tasks and ensure nothing falls through the cracks.

steps.title: Automation Rules Tab
steps.content: Click the Automation tab to access rule creation and management. This is where you'll set up triggers and actions.

steps.title: Create New Rule
steps.content: Click 'New Rule' to create your first automation rule. We'll walk you through the process step by step.

steps.title: Choose a Trigger
steps.content: Select when this automation should run. Common triggers include 'Hearing Updated', 'Document Uploaded', or 'Task Overdue'.

steps.title: Set Conditions
steps.content: Add conditions to filter when the rule runs. For example, 'Next Hearing Date in 3 days' or 'Case Status = Active'.

steps.title: Define Actions
steps.content: Specify what should happen when triggered. You can create tasks, send notifications, or update case status.

steps.title: Test Before Enabling
steps.content: Always test your rule with sample data before enabling it. This prevents issues with live cases.

steps.title: Task Templates
steps.content: Visit the Templates tab to create reusable task bundles for common workflows like 'Hearing Preparation' or 'Appeal Filing'.
